summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of West Sixtieth Street and West Sixty-first Street, each from Twenty-second Avenue Northwest to Twenty-eighth Avenue Northwest; and West Sixty-second Street from a point two hundred sixty-eight (268) feet east of Twenty-fourth Avenue Northwest to Twenty-eighth Avenue Northwest, all in the City of Seattle, by constructing sewers therein of proper dimensions and material, together with all manholes, catch basins, flush tanks and other appurtenances necessary for the proper sewerage and drainage of said district, in accordance with Resolution No. 1458 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
